titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: There seems to be a real danger lest, by attempts to introduce equality, the complicated social system which at present exists may be so disorganised that the mechanism of production w
be put out of order, & that the effect w
be to diminish the aggregate of goods in the community & reduce rather than increase the share of the very poor.
I worked at the Cathedral sermon. The Ordination candidates finished their examination by 5p.m. & went away save Ramsay who stayed the night.
I had a very rudely expressed letter from Moore of S

Peter, whose vanity is sorely mortified at finding himself included in the same category of lawlessness with his neighbour at All Saints. He will no doubt pour out his grievance into the hospitable columns in the local paper. I probably under–estimate the strength of the party passions of these provincials. My letter appeared in the
